snippet: Assistance programs operating in states with their own insurance marketplaces helped more people than those in states relying on the federal exchange, a survey found.
abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation survey reports that more than 4,400 consumer assistance programs created under Affordable Care Act helped an estimated 10.6 million people explore their new heath insurance options and apply for coverage during the initial six-month enrollment period; survey finds that programs operating in states with their own online insurance market places got more funding and helped more people than those in states on federal exchange.
lead_paragraph: Assistance programs operating in states with their own insurance marketplaces helped more people than those in states relying on the federal exchange, a survey found.

headline.seo: Assisters Helped 10.6 Million With Coverage Under A.C.A.
headline.main: Groups Under Health Act Are Said to Aid Millions
headline.print_headline: Groups Under Health Act Are Said to Aid Millions

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
